alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Franklin; Shelby; Spencer (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 03 at 9:41PM EDT until September 04 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Anderson County in central Kentucky... Central Franklin County in central Kentucky... Southeastern Shelby County in central Kentucky... Southeastern Spencer County in central Kentucky... * Until 1245 AM EDT. * At 941 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Frankfort, Bridgeport, Graefenburg, Avenstoke, Evergreen, Broadville Manor, Alton, Farmdale, Capital City Airport and Kennebec. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
